verses.verse: (Deut. 29:23; Ps. 11:6; Is. 30:33) Its streams shall be turned into pitch, And its dust into brimstone; Its land shall become burning pitch.

It shall not be quenched night or day; (Rev. 14:11; 18:18; 19:3) Its smoke shall ascend forever. (Is. 13:20-22; 24:1; 34:10-15; Mal. 1:3, 4) From generation to generation it shall lie waste; No one shall pass through it forever and ever.

(Is. 14:23; Zeph. 2:14; Rev. 18:2) But the pelican and the porcupine shall possess it, Also the owl and the raven shall dwell in it. And (2 Kin. 21:13; Lam. 2:8) He shall stretch out over it The line of confusion and the stones of emptiness.
They shall call its nobles to the kingdom, But none shall be there, and all its princes shall be nothing.
And (Is. 32:13; Hos. 9:6) thorns shall come up in its palaces, Nettles and brambles in its fortresses; (Is. 13:21) It shall be a habitation of jackals, A courtyard for ostriches.
The wild beasts of the desert shall also meet with the jackals, And the wild goat shall bleat to its companion; Also the night creature shall rest there, And find for herself a place of rest.
There the arrow snake shall make her nest and lay eggs And hatch, and gather them under her shadow; There also shall the hawks be gathered, Every one with her mate.
“Search from ((Mal. 3:16)) the book of the LORD, and read: Not one of these shall fail; Not one shall lack her mate. For My mouth has commanded it, and His Spirit has gathered them.
He has cast the lot for them, And His hand has divided it among them with a measuring line. They shall possess it forever; From generation to generation they shall dwell in it.”
The Future Glory of Zion The (Is. 32:15; 55:12) wilderness and the wasteland shall be glad for them, And the (Is. 41:19; 51:3) desert shall rejoice and blossom as the rose;
